summary: Build “StonkSquad”: a web app that turns friends into tradeable “stocks”/profiles by creating a per-user tradable asset on account creation, functioning like an exchange for friend-stocks, with an alpha/trading-forward theme (less cyberpunk, including updated background) while maintaining all existing features, and real-money support via USD fiat on-ramp/off-ramp through Stripe (or equivalent) into an in-app USDC stablecoin balance used for all trading/launches, with compliant KYC/verification, transparent fees, and fair-launch coins starting at $0 market cap.
architectural_notes: Product copy/terminology should avoid crypto jargon; prefer neutral language (e.g., “stocks/shares/credits”) throughout UI.
Friend coins must have a fixed total supply with no inflation/minting after creation; price discovery should be driven purely by order flow (supply/demand).
Replace/avoid the label “SQD balance” across the product; adopt a consistent alternative term (e.g., “Net Worth”).
Gamification/leaderboard ranking metric should be based on creator market cap (market cap of coins a user launched), not portfolio performance or holdings.
App will handle real USD value: implement compliant fiat on-ramp/off-ramp via Stripe (or equivalent) with KYC/verification as required.
In-app trading/coin launches must use an on-chain USDC stablecoin balance (prefer Arbitrum if feasible); gas fees must be accounted for/deducted appropriately.
Add Deposit and Withdraw pages/flows with transparent fee display, risk warnings, withdrawal limits, and anti-fraud checks.
Fair-launch constraint: every new friend coin must launch with market cap exactly $0.
Visual direction for images/illustrations: stoic yet fun (reduce “missions” vibe; emphasize alpha/dominance tone).
Visual theme direction update: shift from cyberpunk to a trading/alpha look-and-feel (including replacing the background), while preserving all existing product features and flows.
known_issues: Theme/copy still feels mission-based; stoic alpha/dominance tone change not applied as expected.
Landing page hero/photo was not updated to match the provided attachment.
Deposit/Withdraw pages currently skip collecting card/payment details; Stripe payment forms/off-ramp are not functioning end-to-end.
Need to verify/enforce that all newly created coins launch with market cap exactly $0 and that coin mechanics/market-cap calculations are correct end-to-end.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Fullscreen trading/alpha background image with subtle finance/terminal vibe, dark neutral palette, minimal neon (alpha-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and an application-level user profile so a user can create an account in StonkSquad using their Internet Identity principal.

Build the StonkSquad frontend UI for: landing page, authenticated dashboard/portfolio, browse/search friend coins, coin detail page with order book and trade ticket, and a simple activity/leaderboard view.
Use React Query to integrate the frontend with the Motoko actor for all reads/writes (profile, mint status, balances, coin list, order book, placing/canceling orders) with loading/error states.

Define and apply one coherent visual theme for StonkSquad (distinct style with consistent color palette, typography, spacing, and component styling) across all pages without using a blue+purple default look.
Add generated static image assets for brand identity and use them in the UI (do not serve images through the backend).

Add anti-impersonation guardrails during profile creation so users must explicitly claim the name they are using, and the system reduces obvious impersonation risks without relying on external identity providers.
Change minted asset naming so it uses only the person’s name/identifier and remove the automatic “_COIN” suffix everywhere (backend storage/lookup and all frontend displays).

Remove/avoid crypto jargon across the app’s user-facing copy so the product does not feel like a crypto app; replace existing crypto-like wording in key screens (landing page, profile setup, dashboard, coins list, coin detail/order book) with plain-English, non-crypto terminology.

Update the app’s visual theme to a techno-futuristic, cyberpunk, alpha/elite aesthetic (sleek, high-energy, dominance/status-symbol vibe) and apply it consistently across all pages (Landing, Dashboard, People/Coins, Coin Detail, Activity/Leaderboard) using Tailwind + existing shadcn components.
Remove the term “SQD balance” from all user-facing UI text and replace it with an elite/neutral term such as “Net Worth” (and update any related helper copy so it stays consistent).

Update quote-currency wording so UI uses elite/neutral terminology for the internal trading currency while keeping functionality intact (e.g., replace “SQD credits” with “Credits” or “Cash” in user-facing copy), and ensure the unit label is consistent anywhere prices are shown (order book tables, trade ticket labels, activity tables, landing copy).

Heavily gamify rank-climbing in the UI by adding visible status symbols and rank progression: show a user rank tier on the Dashboard and render a rank-based leaderboard view on the Activity page (visual-only is acceptable if data is not yet available, but the UI must be fully built and styled to the cyberpunk/elite theme).

Integrate the new backend leaderboard query into the Activity page using React Query, replacing placeholder arrays with live data and rendering loading/error/empty states that match the cyberpunk/elite theme.

Preserve the existing background aesthetic across public and authenticated layouts by keeping the current background image and layering approach intact (including the existing cyberpunk background image asset and its opacity/gradient overlays).

Revise user-facing copy across the Landing page, Dashboard page, and Activity/Leaderboard page to remove overly motivational “mission/elite” framing and replace it with a stoic dominance / alpha presence tone, while keeping all text in English and retaining the existing cyberpunk aesthetic.

Change the ranking/progression metric used by the app so that leaderboards and rank tiers are strictly based on the total market capitalization of coins a user personally launched/created (sum of market caps of coins where the coin owner is that user), explicitly not based on portfolio profits, holdings value, trading gains, or quote-currency balance.

Update the frontend leaderboard and rank utilities to reflect the new metric (creator market cap): update React Query leaderboard hook(s), ActivityPage table columns/labels, and rank tier thresholds/utilities so they operate on creator market cap rather than net worth.
Add authenticated frontend routes and pages for "Deposit / Fund Account" and "Withdraw" with a cyberpunk-elite UI consistent with the existing theme, using English user-facing text.

Integrate the Deposit and Withdraw pages with the backend using React Query: initiate deposit/withdraw intents, display stablecoin balance (labeled as “Stablecoin Balance” or “Funds Balance”), and show loading/error/empty states consistent with the existing theme.

Update existing frontend quote-currency display and trade ticket labeling so order prices and costs are displayed in stablecoin terms (USDC / Funds) rather than the current “Credits” branding, while keeping the rest of the cyberpunk UI intact.

Add compliance-oriented UI copy on Deposit and Withdraw pages: basic verification/KYC messaging (provider-handled), risk warnings, and clear explanations of settlement timing and limits in plain English.

Update the app’s generated brand/hero imagery so the visual tone feels less “mission briefing” and more stoic alpha/dominance, while still being fun (subtle humor/whimsy) and consistent with the existing cyberpunk aesthetic.
Replace the Landing page’s current emblem/hero image sources with the updated stoic-yet-fun versions while keeping the existing layout, background layering, and overall cyberpunk UI styling intact.

Update the Landing page hero/“photo” to use the user-provided uploaded attachment by creating a new static hero banner image asset and switching the Landing page hero to reference the new asset (keep the existing layout, border/glow treatment, and background layering).

Remove the remaining mission/operations framing from user-facing copy and headings, and replace it with a stoic dominance tone (still cyberpunk, still English, but not “mission briefing” language). Apply this across the Landing page, Dashboard page, Activity page, and the authenticated layout header/user menu where applicable.
Ensure the authenticated app shell uses the same updated stoic emblem asset as the public landing page for consistent branding.

Update the Landing page hero main title text to exactly "Dominate the Social Market" and remove any additional words/phrases from that main title block (no extra text inside the H1). Style it to be big, bold, centered, and consistent with the existing stoic alpha/dominance cyberpunk aesthetic (cold, powerful display font treatment).

Replace the current Deposit page flow (which only creates a backend deposit session) with a functional Stripe card payment form using Stripe Elements/Payment Element so users can securely enter: card number, cardholder name, expiration date, and CVC. The page must submit the payment through Stripe and only show success after Stripe confirms payment success.

Implement an end-to-end Stripe deposit crediting flow: after Stripe reports a successful payment, credit the equivalent amount to the caller’s in-app USDC balance in the backend, and refresh the frontend stablecoin balance display accordingly.

Replace the current Withdraw page flow with a functional Stripe-based off-ramp that allows users to withdraw in-app USDC value back to USD/bank via Stripe (including bank linking/collection when required by Stripe). The UI must guide the user through the required Stripe steps and only finalize the withdrawal when the backend confirms the payout/transfer status with Stripe.

Update the app’s visual theme to a less cyberpunk, more trading/alpha aesthetic while maintaining all existing features and routes. This includes updating the global design tokens (colors, typography, radii, shadows/glows) so the UI reads as "trading terminal / alpha" rather than neon cyberpunk, and applying the updated look consistently across Landing, AppShell header/footer, Dashboard, People/Coins, Coin Detail, Activity/Leaderboard, Deposit, and Withdraw pages.

Replace the current cyberpunk background treatment with a new trading/alpha background treatment across both public and authenticated layouts. Update the shared background component (currently frontend/src/components/layout/CyberBackground.tsx) and its usages (e.g., LandingPage and AppShell) so the new background is used everywhere, including appropriate opacity/gradient overlays to preserve readability.

Audit and fix coin/asset flows so that "all coins work correct" end-to-end: coin discovery/listing, symbol resolution, coin detail loading, order book loading, and order placement should behave correctly for any valid symbol, including newly created users/assets. Add or improve frontend empty/error states where backend returns null/missing data, without changing user-facing text away from English.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create StonkSquad app where users mint a meme coin representing themselves on account creation, enabling an exchange for trading friend-stocks.

On first successful account creation, mint a unique per-user meme coin (“friend stock”) representing that user, with deterministic identity (e.g., derived from the user’s principal), and persist all coin metadata and balances in the single Motoko main actor.
Implement an internal trading currency/quote asset (e.g., “SQD credits”) used to buy/sell friend coins, including an initial airdrop to new accounts and balance tracking per principal.
Create a basic exchange mechanism for friend coins that supports placing buy/sell orders quoted in SQD, matching orders, updating balances atomically, and exposing market data needed by the UI.
Add a mechanism to verify/confirm that a user is claiming their real name (prevent impersonation) before/when creating their tradable friend-stock/profile.
Change minted asset naming so it uses just the person’s name (remove the automatic “_coin” suffix) across the product/UI.
Remove/avoid crypto jargon across the app (UI text, labels, and terminology) so it does not feel like a crypto product.
Update backend-generated strings/metadata related to per-user assets so they also avoid crypto jargon and do not include crypto-themed phrases or emojis.
Shift the app’s visual theme to a techno-futuristic, alpha/elite cyberpunk aesthetic (sleek, high-energy, dominance/status-symbol vibe) applied consistently across the UI.
Heavily gamify the experience with rank climbing, prominent leaderboards, and status symbols to reinforce competition and “top-tier player” progression.
Remove/replace the term “SQD balance” everywhere in the UI/copy with a more neutral/elite term (e.g., “Net Worth”), ensuring consistency across all screens.
Enforce fixed total supply for every friend coin (no post-launch minting/inflation), so price discovery is purely supply/demand-driven from trading pressure.

Enforce the core tokenomics rule in the backend: every friend coin created must have a fixed total supply and there must be no mechanism to mint/inflate supply after creation; price discovery must be driven only by user buy/sell pressure (no emissions, unlock schedules, or supply-changing side effects).

Add a public backend query to support leaderboard/rank-climbing UI by returning a ranked list of users with the metric used for ranking (start with quote-currency holdings as the metric, since it exists today).

Update rank/leaderboard progression to be based strictly on the total market cap of coins a user personally created/launched (sum of market caps of their own friend coins), not portfolio P&L, holdings value, trading gains, or quote-currency balance.
Revise product copy/tone to remove overly motivational “mission/elite” framing and instead emphasize stoic dominance/alpha presence while keeping the cyberpunk/elite aesthetic.

Implement backend market-cap calculation for each coin and creator using existing on-chain market data available in the single Motoko actor (orders/order books) and coin total supply, then aggregate per creator for the creator ranking query.
Add secure fiat on-ramp (USD deposits) via Stripe (or equivalent compliant provider) to fund user accounts and credit an in-app USDC stablecoin balance after payment + required KYC/verification.

Add secure fiat off-ramp (USD withdrawals) via Stripe payouts (or integrated off-ramp) to convert in-app USDC stablecoin balance back to USD and send to the user’s linked bank account, with limits and anti-fraud checks.
Add dedicated UI pages/flows for Deposit/Fund Account and Withdraw, showing Stablecoin/Funds balance, risk warnings, and transparent fees/settlement details.
Migrate core in-app trading/launch flows to use real USDC stablecoin balance (on-chain; prefer Arbitrum if possible) including handling gas fees, instead of play-money/internal credits.
Enforce real-funds fair-launch rule: every newly launched friend coin starts with market cap exactly $0 (no pre-seed/dev allocation/starting liquidity that implies non-zero market cap).

Add a stablecoin-denominated funds balance to the backend (USDC) and expose query/mutation methods to (a) read the caller’s stablecoin balance and (b) apply credit/debit adjustments only when tied to a recorded Deposit/Withdraw flow state.

Implement Stripe-based on-ramp and off-ramp flow scaffolding in the backend by storing provider session identifiers and statuses for deposits and withdrawals, so the frontend can initiate a flow and then poll the canister for completion status.

Migrate all in-app trading and order placement logic in the backend to use the stablecoin balance (USDC) as the quote currency instead of the current internal SQD balance, including validation of sufficient funds for buy orders.
Enforce the fair-launch rule in the backend: every newly created friend coin must start with market cap exactly $0 and must not grant the creator any pre-seed/dev allocation at creation time.
Update Landing page main title text to exactly “Dominate the Social Market” and style it big, bold, centered, and stoic alpha/dominance (cold, powerful font; no extra text).

Make Deposit and Withdraw pages truly functional using Stripe: Deposit must collect card details via Stripe Elements/Payment Element and credit equivalent USDC to in-app balance on success; Withdraw must support off-ramp to USD/bank (including bank linking if needed via Stripe payouts).
Change the overall visual theme and background from cyberpunk to a more trading/alpha aesthetic while maintaining all existing features.

Ensure fair-launch behavior by making market cap start at exactly 0 for every newly created asset until there is real market activity establishing a price. Update backend market-cap/price logic so that assets with no valid price-discovery data have current price = 0 and therefore market cap = 0 (rather than a non-zero default).

Fix backend creator market-cap aggregation correctness so that per-creator totals reflect the sum of each created coin’s market cap (current price * totalSupply), and ensure the creator ranking query iterates over the actual creator set (users) rather than relying on unrelated balance maps. Keep the leaderboard metric as creator market cap.
